review: Worked at first but now it does not.  Never hardly any new prime movie additions, those that do get added were available on Netflix or GooglePlay, AppleTV months earlier. I work for a Telecom Company and was given the task of testing out all sorts of streaming devices, including the Roku, AppleTV, WD TV box, the Chromecast and most recently the Fire Stick.  The Chromecast had all kinds of timeout issues, you couldn't pause or stop or cast your screen without issues.  They have since corrected those problems.  For the price I like the fact that the Fire Stick also comes with a remote and the memory is what sold me considering we live in an area with limited bandwidth.  Amazon has the best price for SD current episodes and overall selection.  There were a few minor bugs early on with the Fire Stick and the remote is super sensitive but it worked great at the beginning.  Now after several months I'm asking what memory, preloaded movies...I don't think so.  I might as well be on dial up with the time outs and latency issues.  I thought is was related to my companies broadband but I ruled that out and tried out the Chromecast again for a movies/shows we were trying to watch via Netflix and the Fire Stick and guess what?  perfect picture and audio, no delays, latency or timeouts.  So what good is all the supposed extra advertised"4x the storage and 2x the memory of Chromecast plus a dual-core processor and 1 GB of memory," if it won't play content without freezing up.  I get having problems, limitations up front but this is after the fact.  Stick with Chromecast, Roku or AppleTV.
